summary: Three friends from a rough Los Angeles neighborhood embark on a wild night of out-of-control partying, but when the rampage stops, the retribution begins.

reviews.content: Every single thing this man touched is gold. I don't understand it but I'm beyond invested in the ride.
Amazing cast, but it didn't make sense. Make it make sense.

Made these 3 like they were heros what joke beating ppl on streets home invasion tried to make us care for them only one was the one molested another senseless movie of kids being violent in time were all we see is violence wonder kids are each other an rest of the world no  by choice gets to feel their wrath acting like the consequences of their actions was to harsh if anything this movie should wake up people that you need to watch your be back anywhere anytime

This film is meant to be watched by those who have grappled with and continue to be impacted by trauma, particularly of a very heinous nature. It's an ode to survivors and sends a powerful message about what life is worth and how we should cherish it.
I can only think that those who don't see the artistry in this film must not have ever known such suffering. 
To me, this is a truly beautiful film that captures the essence of surviving and coping with life's inescapable injustices and contradiction. 
Bravo üëè
Coming of age, harsh reality of life in some areas. Relatable movie. Has an exciting indie feel.
Just didn't get into it some parts weren't that good

Painful, depressing, and  heartbreaking‚Ä¶.yet sadly familiar. 
It was all that‚Ä¶..and very good.

Great watch , amazing cast, underrated and as far too often happens is panned by the all-knowing "critics". The same critics that led the way for an after school special like Coda to win best picture. This is the real new cinema that takes chances with unknown faces and risk taking directing which combined make for something special here. Gully is rough to watch at times, but pulls no punches.

This cast was great and their acting was great but the film just fell flat. I didn't really get the plot. It just felt like a bunch of amazing actors got together to just be. I wish it had more of a understanding plot. Seemed like a waste of potential

Great Story, not for everyone deep in retrospect with an outstanding cast of young talented actors as well as some veterans! Definitely better than the score given by Rotten Tomatoes! I suggest you watch it and decide for yourself!

Complete amateur hour (and a half) filmmaking. I understand what he was going for but it's a complete miss... the story is good, if he would just hunker down and tell the story it would be good but this director is scatterbrained... scatterbrained is a complete understatement too.

Great acting. Could have been much better w a different script. It was very mediocre the story that is. I thought the scenes were well directed and as stated before the acting was superb just fell very short with the story line. Needed more body and story. Whoever wrote this was most at fault. Prob good on paper but not on film.

this movie very accurately represented ptsd, flashbacks, and the way that trauma actually effects a person. as for the schizophrenia, i think it was somewhat inaccurate but probably better than the way most movies represent that kind of thing. it starts out pretty contrived in some ways but improves as it goes along. i am not sure why they chose to include so many heavy handed GTA references, though. overall, the summary of the movie does not do it justice in any way, as it paints it as "a single night of debauchery" or something, when it really is a much more complex drama than it is some kind of rehash of spring breakers with male protagonists
I thought the acting was incredible. Fantastic young talent - which is great to see. Lots of holes in the plot but with suspension of disbelief I thought it was a good watch.

3 out of 5 stars. A story about three troubled teens causing trouble by stealing. Beating and vandalising. Story does enter dark territory of sexual abuse and abuse within the family. The direction does have trouble trying to find its footing. Decent acting. And dull script.

The struggle to get through a film like this isn't necessarily because the filmmakers haven't delivered an unwatchable and unprofessional film.  On the contrary they have shown that they are very good at coaxing good performances from their cast and creating some dire situations.  The problem here is they fail to come up with a reason to tell such an unpleasant story that fails to make us care about a single character.  It is more frustrating because of it.  The outcome should ultimately be worth the struggle.

Not the best directorial debut. There's not much of a moral, just that humans are awful. The style is unoriginal as well. It has a good idea but is poor in execution. It also lacks the grit of its contemporaries. P.s. Terrence Howard's role as a wise vagrant served little to no purpose than to wind me up with his nonsensical lines delivered under the guise of wisdom.
Movie have nothing good, so they tried aesthetics method. Failed miserably
I think that the producers made a series of poor decisions and it reflects in the confusion one is left with after watching this film. There are better things to watch.
Unique, violent, art. Point of view that is not often looked at. Everyone in this did a great job. I`ve seen most of these actors before, they all showed their range in this.
Waist of my time bored üò¥

I don't believe the movie deserve such a low rating. They was definitely alot to explore in this movie and the weiter/director chose to focus on many stories rather deeply exploring a few such as the parental relationships happening, the various faces of mental health, peer influence and positive relationships, abuse and even the struggles of young "love" of two people so similar but so different.

Overall though, I really enjoyed this movie. Lots to think about and beautiful to look at. Definitely worthy of a higher rating.

This movie was hands down one of the worst things I've ever seen. It was on par with Adam Sandlers first film overboard. There is no plot and as you're watching this movie you're waiting for something to happen and it never does

I enjoyed this movie thoroughly. It was an accurate depiction of poor mental health amongst young men in problematic environments. Calvin was like people I've seen before. Even small moments like Calvin fake shooting the person while he was riding his skateboard made me believe in his character.
I really dislike Amber Heard, but the movie outside of her was astounding.
Incredibly forgettable and mediocre story, bland cookie-cutter characters. Why was this even made?
Will keep you on your seat and emotionally invested. Too invested. Was practically balling through the whole thing. Such an amazing film
Lame, lame, lame!  Confusing and disjointed.  Poor acting also.
No real direction to the movie and to say that the character arcs were weak would be an under statement.
Kinda surreal with visual effects at first.
